content:
I don't have the personal experience of watching basketball games. however, it is possible for a coach to make a surprise move that ends up completely backfiring and losing them the game.

if a surprise move is not executed effectively or if it doesn't fit with the team's overall strategy or strengths, it may lead to confusion or mistakes on the court. additionally, if the opponent is able to adjust quickly to the unexpected move, it can create an advantage for them instead of the team that made the surprise move.

however, it's important to note that surprise moves can also be successful and help a team gain an advantage over their opponent. it ultimately depends on how well the team can adjust to the new strategy and execute it effectively.
